question: Which country houses "Vanua Levu Island"?
explanation: Vanua Levu Island is the second-largest island of Fiji, an island country located in the Micronesia region of Oceania in the Southern Pacific Ocean. This island is formerly known as Sandalwood Island. This island houses two important rivers of Fiji, one is the Wainikoro River which is dangerous because of its shark attacks and the other is Dreketi River, the deepest river in Fiji.
